## StyleSelector interface

Base \[StyleSelector\] attributes required to match \[Style\] object against given feature.

Contains \[Style\]'s members related to feature matching in \[\[StyleSetEvaluator\]\].

<b>Signature:</b>

```typescript
export interface StyleSelector 
```

## Properties

|  Property | Type | Description |
|  --- | --- | --- |
|  [final](./harp-datasource-protocol.styleselector.final.md) | boolean | Optional. If <code>true</code>, no more matching styles will be evaluated. |
|  [layer](./harp-datasource-protocol.styleselector.layer.md) | string | The layer containing the carto features processed by this style rule. |
|  [when](./harp-datasource-protocol.styleselector.when.md) | string \| [JsonExpr](./harp-datasource-protocol.jsonexpr.md) | Condition that is applied to feature properties to check if given \[\[Style\]\] this feature should emit geometry of this style.<!-- -->Conditions are defined using \[\[Array\]\]s describing literals, built-in symbols and function calls: - <code>[&quot;has&quot;, string]</code> returns <code>true</code> if the given property exists. - <code>[&quot;get&quot;, string]</code> returns the value of the given feature property with the given name. - <code>[&quot;all&quot;, expressions...]</code> returns <code>true</code> if all the sub expressions evaluate to true. - <code>[&quot;any&quot;, expressions...]</code> returns <code>true</code> if any sub expression evaluates to true. - <code>[&quot;in&quot;, expression, [literals...]]</code> returns <code>true</code> if the result of evaluating the first expression is included in the given <code>Array</code> of literals. - <code>[&quot;!&quot;, expression]</code> returns <code>false</code> if the sub expression evaluates to <code>true</code>. - <code>[&quot;&lt;&quot;, expression, expression]</code> returns <code>true</code> if the result of evaluating the first expression is less than the result of evaluating the second expression. - <code>[&quot;&gt;&quot;, expression, expression]</code> returns <code>true</code> if the result of evaluating the first expression is greater than the result of evaluating the second expression. - <code>[&quot;&lt;=&quot;, expression, expression]</code> returns <code>true</code> if the result of evaluating the first expression is less than or equal the result of evaluating the second expression. - <code>[&quot;&gt;=&quot;, expression, expression]</code> returns <code>true</code> if the result of evaluating the first expression is greater than or equal the result of evaluating the second expression. - <code>[&quot;==&quot;, expression, expression]</code> returns <code>true</code> if the result of evaluating the first expression is equal the result of evaluating the second expression. - <code>[&quot;!=&quot;, expression, expression]</code> returns <code>true</code> if the result of evaluating the first expression is not equal to the result of evaluating the second expression. - <code>[&quot;length&quot;, expression]</code> returns the length of the given expression if it evaluates to a <code>string</code> or an <code>Array</code>; otherwise, returns <code>undefined</code>. - <code>[&quot;~=&quot;, expression, expression]</code> if the expressions evaluate to <code>string</code>, returns <code>true</code> if the <code>string</code> obtained from the first expression contains the <code>string</code> obtained from the second expression; otherwise, returns <code>undefined</code>. - <code>[&quot;^=&quot;, expression, expression]</code> if the expressions evaluate to <code>string</code>, returns <code>true</code> if the <code>string</code> obtained from the first expression starts with the <code>string</code> obtained from the second expression; otherwise, returns <code>undefined</code>. - <code>[&quot;$=&quot;, expression, expression]</code> if the expressions evaluate to <code>string</code>, returns <code>true</code> if the <code>string</code> obtained from the first expression ends with the <code>string</code> obtained from the second expression; otherwise, returns <code>undefined</code>. |
